article:
A friend wrote me an e-mail the other day. Her letter started with the usual greetings, but then turned sour as she began to   _   the pain in her heart.
My friend doesn't get along well with her parents.   _   she is an 18-year-old high-school student, her parents,   _   her father, are still trying to control her life.
"Obviously I haven't    _   the level of excellence they expect," She wrote, adding, "They're never satisfied with what I do. Every time I see them, my confidence gets   _   ."
I understand my friend's   _   .I know what it's like when people reject my   _   and insist I do what they    _  . I know I have to give her a    _   . Still, I have to be honest, and try to give her useful   _   .
I think she needs to find it in herself to    _  her parents. I don't think many of us truly    _   the power of forgiveness.   Instead of   forgiving, we get angry, and that   _   is often reflected   in our words and actions. We want those who have hurt us to be 45 _  in some way.
I still remember something that happened to me in high school. A friend said something    _  about me and I didn't say a word to her for months. Years later I   _   that although my actions seemed reasonable at the time, my hurt feelings were not worth losing a good   _  . I regret that I did not forgive her.
The power of forgiveness is truly   _  . Learn to forgive, and when you do so you'll find yourself   _  . And you can also set yourself free to experience peace and love.
